sentence.Network_en: He looked straight ahead and overtook a lumbering lorry.
sentence.Network_cn: 他眼睛直视前方，加速超过了前面一辆慢吞吞行进的大卡车。

sentence.Network_en: Lumbering and, later, paper - making were carried out in smaller cities.
sentence.Network_cn: 木材业和后来的造纸都由较小的城市经营.

sentence.Network_en: Lumbering is very important in some underdeveloped countries.
sentence.Network_cn: 在一些不发达的国家,伐木业十分重要.

entry.def: Lumber consists of trees and large pieces of wood that have been roughly cut up.

example.ex: It was made of soft lumber, spruce by the look of it...
example.tran: 其制作材料是软木，看起来像是云杉。

example.ex: He was going to have to purchase all his lumber at full retail price.
example.tran: 他将不得不把所有木材按零售价分文不少地买下来。

entry.def: If someone or something lumbers from one place to another, they move there very slowly and clumsily.

example.ex: He turned and lumbered back to his chair...
example.tran: 他转过身来，蹒跚着走回到椅子边坐下。

example.ex: The truck lumbered across the parking lot toward the road...
example.tran: 卡车隆隆地驶过停车场准备上路。

means.word_mean: 1. the trade of cutting or preparing or selling timber
1. slow and laborious because of weight;

auth_sentence.content: The process was long considered to be slow, even lumbering.
auth_sentence.res_content: The process was long considered to be slow, even lumbering.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The process was long considered to be slow, even lumbering.

auth_sentence.content: Incandescent lightbulbs are lumbering toward extinction.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Incandescent lightbulbs are lumbering toward extinction.
